Brigitte Macron's never-ending fake news nightmare
subhead: For four years, the absurd rumor that the French first lady is a man has continually spread. The Macrons have taken legal action, both in France and in the US.

title: US sends aircraft carrier to Latin America as military campaign escalates against alleged drug trafficking
subhead: Trump said Thursday he did not need a declaration of war from US lawmakers to attack Venezuela or other countries he accuses of involvement in the drug trade, warning that strikes on land are coming. Starting in early September, the US has been targeting vessels, allegedly used to smuggle narcotics, in a series of deadly strikes.

title: The Fondation Cartier unveils its new landmark in central Paris
subhead: The Fondation Cartier for Contemporary Art has moved to Place du Palais-Royal in Paris. Like its previous location on Boulevard Raspail, the new building was designed by architect Jean Nouvel, conceived as an innovative, flexible space that can be configured in countless ways.

title: First loves: '20 years later, our bodies recognize each other, it's crazy'
subhead: They met, fell in love and then parted ways. Life's twists and turns eventually brought them back together. Marion, 40, shares her story with Ewen, 43, who will give his version of their reunion in the next installment.

title: 'The Thiaroye massacre in Senegal in 1944 marked the reestablishment of colonial order'
subhead: Mamadou Diouf, historian and president of the committee tasked with investigating the killing by France of African tirailleurs, places this event within African memory in an interview with Le Monde, and laments the difficulty of accessing French archives.

'The Louvre's stolen jewels, valuable only for their gemstones, are above all outdated and cumbersome'
subhead: Reactions to the Louvre heist ignore the complex equation museums face: offering generous public access while securing cumbersome objects better suited for a bank vault, explains Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: Sarkozy imprisonment: Protection of ex-president by armed officers angers prison guards
subhead: On Wednesday, interior minister Laurent Nuñez defended the measure, citing Nicolas Sarkozy's 'status' and 'threats against him.' Prison guard unions decried it as 'security madness' and 'unprecedented humiliation.'
byline: By Antoine Albertini, Grégoire Biseau and Soren Seelow

title: Twelve artistic happenings to catch outside Art Basel Paris
subhead: Alongside the fourth edition of the event, a host of events are taking place in various venues across the French capital. From exhibitions and monumental installations to off-site fairs, here is a selection from Le Monde's culture journalists.
